subprocess_flow.description: The first step in the release process is to prepare the release package. This involves gathering all the necessary components, including the software binaries, configuration files, and any supporting documentation. The package is then versioned and tagged for easy identification and tracking. This ensures that all components are properly assembled and ready for deployment.
success_criteria: Release package is complete and versioned
subprocess_flow.purpose: Assemble all necessary components into a deployable package.
subprocess_flow.scope: Packaging of software and related artifacts.

subprocess_flow.description: Before deploying to production, the release package is deployed to a staging environment. This environment closely mirrors the production environment and is used to perform final testing and validation. This step helps to identify any potential issues or conflicts before they impact the live system. The deployment process is automated to ensure consistency and reduce the risk of human error.
subprocess_flow.purpose: Validate the release package in a production-like environment.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Automated deployment scripts and rollback plan

subprocess_flow.description: Once the release package is deployed to the staging environment, a series of post-deployment tests are conducted. These tests include functional testing, performance testing, and security testing to ensure that the system is working as expected and that there are no vulnerabilities. The System Architect and Development Teams collaborate to validate the deployed features and ensure they meet the defined success criteria.
subprocess_flow.purpose: Ensure the deployed features function correctly and meet quality standards.
end_conditions: Testing complete and validation report approved

subprocess_flow.description: After successful testing in the staging environment, final approval is obtained from the process owner and relevant stakeholders. This approval confirms that the release is ready for deployment to production. The Release Train Engineer (RTE) ensures that all governance requirements have been met and that all stakeholders are aligned on the release plan.
success_criteria: Final approval obtained from all stakeholders
subprocess_flow.purpose: Secure stakeholder agreement before production deployment.
triggers: Testing complete and validation report approved

subprocess_flow.description: With final approval in hand, the release package is deployed to the production environment. This deployment is carefully monitored to ensure that everything goes smoothly. The Deployment Management team uses automated deployment tools to minimize downtime and ensure consistency. The System Architect oversees the deployment to ensure architectural integrity and stability.
subprocess_flow.purpose: Make the new features available to end-users.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Automated deployment scripts and rollback plan

subprocess_flow.description: After the deployment to production, the system is closely monitored to ensure that everything is working as expected. This includes monitoring system performance, error logs, and user feedback. The System Team and Development Teams collaborate to quickly address any issues that arise. This monitoring continues for a defined period to ensure stability and performance.
subprocess_flow.purpose: Ensure the deployed features are stable and perform as expected in production.
subprocess_flow.scope: Monitoring and issue resolution in production.
end_conditions: Monitoring period complete and system stable

step_risks_and_controls.control: Automated monitoring tools and incident response plan

subprocess_flow.description: Finally, the release is documented, including any changes made, issues encountered, and resolutions implemented. This documentation is stored in a central repository for future reference. The Release Notes are updated to reflect the final state of the release, and any lessons learned are captured for continuous improvement. This ensures that the organization has a clear record of the release process and can learn from past experiences.
success_criteria: Release documentation is complete and accurate
subprocess_flow.purpose: Maintain a record of the release for future reference and continuous improvement.
subprocess_flow.scope: Documentation and archiving of release information.
triggers: Monitoring period complete and system stable
